name: AddDeploymentGroupMachine
description: Adds 1 or more machines to a specified deployment group.
author: Chris Gardner

inputs.name: DeploymentGroupName
inputs.label: Deployment Group Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the Deployment Group to join target machine to.

inputs.name: AccessToken
inputs.label: Access Token
inputs.helpMarkDown: Access token with Deployment Group Read/Manage permissions to allow registering registering the target machines with the Deployment Group.

inputs.name: Project
inputs.label: Project
inputs.helpMarkDown: Project containing the deployment group. Defaults to the current project containing this task.

inputs.name: ComputerName
inputs.label: Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide a comma separated list of machine IP addresses or FQDNs along with ports. Port is defaulted based on the selected protocol.
Eg: dbserver.fabrikam.com,dbserver_int.fabrikam.com:5986,192.168.12.34:5986
Or provide output variable of other tasks. Eg: $(variableName)
If you are using HTTPS, name/IP of machine should match the CN in the certificate.

inputs.name: AdminUserName
inputs.label: Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Administrator login for the target machines.
Eg: Format: Domain\Admin User, Admin User@Domain, .\Admin User

inputs.name: AdminPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Administrator password for the target machines.
It can accept variable defined in build or release pipelines as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: Replace
inputs.label: Replace Existing
inputs.helpMarkDown: Replaces existing machines if they are registered already. Good for short lived environments that are recreated with the same names.

inputs.name: Protocol
inputs.label: Protocol
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the protocol to use for the WinRM service connection with the machine(s). Default is HTTPS.

inputs.name: TestCertificate
inputs.label: Test Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to skip validating the authenticity of the machine's certificate by a trusted certification authority. The parameter is required for the WinRM HTTPS protocol.
